Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10278984286/job/28443558969)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10278984286/job/28443558723)

```suggestion
/-- `autGalois.œÄ` is surjective for every pointed Galois object. -/
theorem AutGalois.œÄ_surjective [FiberFunctor F] (A : PointedGaloisObject F) :
```

I don't understand this change. There is `[RingHomClass F R S]` in scope, and the statement uses `f : F` and `I : Ideal R` and `K : Ideal S`, so normally `[RingHomClass F R S]` should be pulled in by the new algorithm. If it isn't, it is probably a bug, that should be fixed instead of adding the assumption (unless I'm misunderstanding something). 

Same thing for the next statements.
Good catch. This was working around an earlier bug that is now fixed in 4814. (Not pulling in things mentioned via the type of something pulled in.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: backports for leanprover/lean4#4814 (part 18)
